entry.title: Error-correction of linear codes via colon ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we show that errors in transmitted data can be thought of as codewords of minimum weight of new linear codes. To determine the errors we can then use methods specific to finding such special codewords. One of these methods consists of finding the primary decomposition of the saturation of a certain homogeneous ideal. When good messages (i.e., vectors with a unique nearest neighbor) are error-corrected, the saturated ideal is just the prime ideal of a point (so the primary decomposition is superfluously determined); the computation of this ideal can also be done by colon the original homogeneous ideal with a power of a certain variable. We then prove an upper bound for this power for MDS codes. Finally, we use the upper bound to describe the minimal graded free resolution of a certain class of ideals generated by products of linear forms.
